Package org.wikidata.wdtk.datamodel.interfaces

Interface LexemeDocument

All Superinterfaces:
EntityDocument, StatementDocument
All Known Implementing Classes:
LexemeDocumentImpl
public interface LexemeDocument extends StatementDocument
Interface for datasets that describe lexemes.
Author:
Thomas Pellissier Tanon

    • withStatement

      LexemeDocument withStatement(Statement statement)
      Returns a new version of this document which includes the statement provided. If the identifier of this statement matches that of any other statement for the same property, then the existing statement will be replaced by the new one. Otherwise, the new statement will be added at the end of the list of statements in this group.
      Specified by:
      withStatement in interface StatementDocument
      Parameters:
      statement - the statement to add or update in the document

    • withoutStatementIds

      LexemeDocument withoutStatementIds(Set<String> statementIds)
      Returns a new version of this document where all statements matching any of the statement ids provided have been removed. These statements can use different properties.
      Specified by:
      withoutStatementIds in interface StatementDocument
      Parameters:
      statementIds - the identifiers of the statements to remove

    • createForm

      FormDocument createForm(List<MonolingualTextValue> representations)
      Creates a new FormDocument for this lexeme. The form is not added to the LexemeDocument object, it should be done with withForm(org.wikidata.wdtk.datamodel.interfaces.FormDocument).

    • withForm

      LexemeDocument withForm(FormDocument form)
      Adds a FormDocument to this lexeme. The form id should be prefixed with the lexeme id.

    • createSense

      SenseDocument createSense(List<MonolingualTextValue> glosses)
      Creates a new SenseDocument for this Lexeme. The form is not added to the LexemeDocument object, it should be done with withSense(org.wikidata.wdtk.datamodel.interfaces.SenseDocument).

    • withSense

      LexemeDocument withSense(SenseDocument sense)
      Adds a SenseDocument to this lexeme. The sense id should be prefixed with the lexeme id.
